intro: Hemitelia megalosora, commonly known as the giant hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 15 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Hemitelia megalosora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and marshy areas.
